intro: Adenocalymma heterophyllum, commonly known as the variable adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded areas within forests. The leaves are alternate and ovate, with a rough texture that aids in water retention.
